original_solution_mapping.L1: Half of the floors have different numbers of apartments. Half the number of floors is 12 floors / 2 = <<12/2=6>>6 floors.
original_solution_mapping.L2: One half of the block consists of 6 floors * 6 apartments/floor = <<6*6=36>>36 apartments.
original_solution_mapping.L3: And the other half consists of 6 floors * 5 apartments/floor = <<6*5=30>>30 apartments.
original_solution_mapping.L4: There are 30 + 36 = <<30+36=66>>66 apartments on all floors in the block.
original_solution_mapping.L5: All the apartments can therefore accommodate 66 apartments * 4 residents/apartment = <<66*4=264>>264 residents.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 645.
    Returns: the maximum number of residents that can live in the block of flats.
    """
    # L1
    total_floors = 12 # This block has 12 floors
    half_divisor = 2 # Half of the floors
    half_floors = total_floors / half_divisor

    # L2
    apartments_per_floor_half1 = 6 # Half of the floors have 6 apartments
    apartments_half1 = half_floors * apartments_per_floor_half1

    # L3
    apartments_per_floor_half2 = 5 # the other half have 5 apartments
    apartments_half2 = half_floors * apartments_per_floor_half2

    # L4
    total_apartments = apartments_half2 + apartments_half1

    # L5
    max_residents_per_apartment = 4 # One apartment can accommodate a maximum of 4 residents
    max_residents = total_apartments * max_residents_per_apartment

    # FA
    answer = max_residents
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Half of the floors have different numbers of apartments. Half the number of floors is {total_floors} floors / {half_divisor} = <<{total_floors}/{half_divisor}={half_floors}>>{half_floors} floors.

One half of the block consists of {half_floors} floors * {apartments_per_floor_half1} apartments/floor = <<{half_floors}*{apartments_per_floor_half1}={apartments_half1}>>{apartments_half1} apartments.
And the other half consists of {half_floors} floors * {apartments_per_floor_half2} apartments/floor = <<{half_floors}*{apartments_per_floor_half2}={apartments_half2}>>{apartments_half2} apartments.
There are {apartments_half2} + {apartments_half1} = <<{apartments_half2}+{apartments_half1}={total_apartments}>>{total_apartments} apartments on all floors in the block.

All the apartments can therefore accommodate {total_apartments} apartments * {max_residents_per_apartment} residents/apartment = <<{total_apartments}*{max_residents_per_apartment}={max_residents}>>{max_residents} residents.
